intro: Caraipa grandifolia subsp. lacerdaei, commonly known as the Lacerdaei caraipa, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with a velvety texture and deep green color. Its flowers are showy, with five petals that range in color from white to pale pink. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
